availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oren F. Miner (Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, notary public, tax assessor, and clerk)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, notary public, tax assessor, and clerk. New York native. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Partner with George W. Robertson in G.W. Robertson and Company booksellers in Jefferson County in 1861. Notary public in Jefferson County in 1862. Assistant tax assessor in Louisville in 1862. Chief clerk of the United States Assessors’ Office in Jefferson County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, p. 357.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 31B.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 175, 207.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 445.
"Excise Taxes." Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), November 10, 1862.
